fields.headline: Live music booking now
fields.bodyText: With the next incarnation of their BlakRoc hip-hop project coming soon, blues-rock duo The Black Keys are also finishing off their Danger Mouse-produced album – hear the resulting Cramps and rockabilly-inspired tunes live early next year (3-10 Feb 2012, starting at Capital FM Arena, Nottingham) … The new Pure Festival allows you to get sauced, or rather, responsibly sample a fine range of whisky while enjoying "whisky-loving bands" who apparently include the Raveonettes, James Yorkston and Steve Mason (24 & 25 Sep, The Garage, N5) … Kevin Smith and Jason Mewes bring over a live version of their smodcasts when they take up their slacker Clerks characters for a tour of Jay & Silent Bob Get Old (17-21 Feb 2012, starting at Manchester Apollo) … A Goner Records showcase comes from Memphis, featuring Jack Oblivian, Harlan T Bobo and Limes at a Dirty Water Club reunion (2 Dec, Boston Music Room, N19) … Tickets for next year's Reading and Leeds festivals are now on sale (24-26 Aug 2012, Little John's Farm, Reading, and Bramham Park, Leeds).
